total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the non-zero elements in the input grid and their positions.
Q2: For each non-zero element, create a 3x3 grid with the non-zero element at the center.
Q3: For each 3x3 grid, fill the remaining cells with the non-zero element based on the pattern in the examples.
Q4: Combine all 3x3 grids to form the output grid.
Q1: Identify the non-zero elements in the input grid and their positions.
Q2: For each non-zero element, create a 3x3 grid with the non-zero element at the center.
Q3: For each 3x3 grid, fill the remaining cells with the non-zero element based on the pattern in the examples.
Q4: Combine all 3x3 grids to form the output grid.
Q1: Identify the non-zero elements in the input grid and their positions.
Q2: For each non-zero element, create a 3x3 grid with the non-zero element at the center.
Q3: For each 3x3 grid, fill the remaining cells according to the pattern in the examples. The pattern is that the non-zero element is mirrored along both the vertical and horizontal axes.
Q4: Combine all the 3x3 grids to form the final output grid. The position of each 3x3 grid in the final output grid corresponds to the position of the non-zero element in the input grid.
